actor_awards.notes: Best known for playing the title character in 'The Wizard of Oz' (1939). He was nominated for Best Actor for 'The Affairs of Cellini' (1934) and Best Supporting Actor for 'Tortilla Flat' (1942). He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

filmography.title: The Wizard of Oz
filmography.role: The Wizard / Professor Marvel / Doorman / Cabbie / Guard
filmography.role_description: The carnival magician and the fraudulent but kind-hearted ruler of Oz, along with several other characters.
filmography.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song, Best Original Score

filmography.title: The Shop Around the Corner
filmography.role_description: The well-meaning but emotionally volatile owner of the gift shop who suspects his wife of infidelity.
filmography.plot: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

filmography.title: The Affairs of Cellini
filmography.role_description: The bumbling and easily manipulated Duke who is cuckolded by the artist Benvenuto Cellini.
filmography.plot: A comedic take on the life of artist Benvenuto Cellini, focusing on his romantic entanglements with the Duchess of Florence.

filmography.title: Tortilla Flat
filmography.role_description: A simple-minded, dog-loving hermit who hoards money to buy a candlestick for St. Francis.
filmography.plot: Based on John Steinbeck's novel about a group of camaraderie-loving paisanos in Monterey, California.

filmography.title: The Mortal Storm
filmography.role_description: A beloved Jewish university professor whose family and life are torn apart by the rise of the Nazis.
filmography.plot: A family in 1933 Germany is torn apart when the father, a Jewish science professor, refuses to bow to the new Nazi regime.

filmography.title: The Great Ziegfeld
filmography.role_description: A rival producer and friend to Florenz Ziegfeld.
filmography.plot: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., the producer who became Broadway's biggest showman.

filmography.title: The Human Comedy
filmography.role_description: An aging, alcoholic telegraph operator who struggles with the tragic news he must transmit during WWII.
filmography.plot: A teenager in a small California town works as a telegraph messenger during World War II, delivering news of love and death.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: The Good Fairy
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, eccentric meat-packing tycoon who tries to woo a young usherette.
filmography.plot: A naive usherette tries to help a waiter by manipulating a wealthy businessman.

filmography.title: Bombshell
filmography.role_description: The unscrupulous, leeching father of movie star Lola Burns (Jean Harlow).
filmography.plot: A screwball comedy about a Hollywood starlet trying to escape the madness of her life, her studio, and her family.

filmography.title: Naughty Marietta
filmography.role_description: The befuddled Governor of Louisiana in this operetta adaptation.
filmography.plot: A French princess flees an arranged marriage by traveling to New Orleans, where she falls for a mercenary scout.

filmography.title: The Three Musketeers
filmography.role_description: The weak-willed King of France who is manipulated by Cardinal Richelieu.
filmography.plot: D'Artagnan and his musketeer friends fight to protect the King and Queen of France from the schemes of Cardinal Richelieu.

filmography.title: The Stratton Story
filmography.role_description: A former ballplayer who discovers and mentors Monty Stratton.
filmography.plot: The true story of Monty Stratton, a White Sox pitcher who lost his leg in a hunting accident but made a courageous comeback.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Green Dolphin Street
filmography.role_description: The father of the two sisters who are the focus of a romantic mix-up.
filmography.plot: A man drunkenly writes a letter proposing to the wrong sister, leading to years of complications in 19th-century New Zealand.

filmography.title: Boom Town
filmography.role_description: An oil equipment supplier who deals with the wildcatters played by Gable and Tracy.
filmography.plot: Two friends strike it rich in the oil fields but their friendship is tested by romance and business rivalry.

filmography.title: Honky Tonk
filmography.role_description: A crooked but likeable judge and father to Lana Turner's character.
filmography.plot: A con man takes over a small town but meets his match in the daughter of a local judge.

filmography.title: Broadway Melody of 1940
filmography.role_description: A bumbling theatrical producer who mixes up a dance team.
filmography.plot: An aspiring dance team is split up when a producer mistakes one partner for the other.

filmography.title: Sweethearts
filmography.role_description: The frantic producer of a Broadway show trying to keep his stars from leaving.
filmography.plot: A husband-and-wife musical comedy team try to escape their demanding schedule and producer for a quiet life.

filmography.title: The White Cliffs of Dover
filmography.role_description: The American father of the protagonist who visits her in England.
filmography.plot: An American woman travels to England in 1914, meets a baronet, loses him in WWI, and raises her son to fight in WWII.

filmography.title: Saratoga
filmography.role_description: A horse owner and friend to the main characters in Jean Harlow's final film.
filmography.plot: A bookie and the daughter of a horse breeder clash and fall in love at the races.

filmography.title: Rosalie
filmography.role_description: The ventriloquism-loving King of a fictional Balkan country.
filmography.plot: A cadet at West Point falls in love with a princess in disguise.

filmography.title: Dimples
filmography.role_description: The petty thief grandfather of Shirley Temple's character.
filmography.plot: A young street entertainer lives with her pickpocket grandfather in 1850s New York City.

filmography.title: A Stranger in Town
filmography.role_description: A Supreme Court Justice who goes on a vacation incognito and uncovers local corruption.
filmography.plot: A Supreme Court Justice vacationing in a small town helps a young lawyer fight a corrupt political machine.

filmography.title: Hallelujah I'm a Bum
filmography.role_description: The Mayor of New York who suffers amnesia and befriends a hobo.
filmography.plot: A popular hobo and the Mayor of New York both fall for the same girl.

filmography.title: Summer Holiday
filmography.role_description: The alcohol-loving uncle in this musical adaptation of 'Ah, Wilderness!'.
filmography.plot: A musical slice of life in a small New England town at the turn of the century.

filmography.title: Key to the City
filmography.role_description: Morgan's final film role, playing a fire chief at a mayors' convention.
filmography.plot: Two mayors meet at a convention in San Francisco and fall in love despite their political differences.
